entry.title: Maximal syzygies in equivariant cohomology
entry.summary: Let T be a torus of rank r and X a compact orientable T-manifold. The equivariant cohomology H_T^*(X;Q) is a finitely generated module over the polynomial ring R = H^*(BT;Q). By a result of Allday, Puppe and the author, if H_T^*(X;Q) is a syzygy of order m >= r/2, then it is already free over R. In this note we show that this bound is sharp. Our examples, called 'big polygon spaces', are intersections of real quadrics and related to polygon spaces, which appear as their fixed point sets. They are also the first examples of compact orientable T-manifolds for which the equivariant Poincare pairing is perfect although H_T^*(X;Q) is not free over R.
